title: 社会性别（gender）理论的荒谬性
content:
原文：The Absurdity of Gender Theory /By Micah Mattix, Jan 19, 2015

本想在正文中将 sex 译作「生理性别」/「性」，gender 译作「社会性别」/「性别」——但这种区分似乎助长了 gender 的荒谬地位。故这里有意混淆 sex / gender，通译为「性别」，或直接用英文表达。还请读者适当地中英对照。

In May 2013, François Hollande signed a controversial bill that made France the ninth country in Europe and the fourteenth in the world to legalize gay marriage. A little over six months later, news that a program called l’ABCD de l’égalité (the ABCs of Egality) was being introduced to six hundred French elementary schools sparked widespread protests after parents were told that it taught that gender was simply a construct of social customs.

2013 年 5 月，弗朗索瓦·奥朗德签署了一项有争议的法案，使法国成为欧洲第九个、世界第十四个将同性婚姻合法化的国家。就在六个多月后，一项名为「DE l’égalité de ABC」（平等的 ABC 们）的项目被引入法国 600 多所小学的消息引发了广泛抗议，原因是，家长们被告知，它会教导孩子们性别（gender）仅仅是社会习俗的建构。

School officials defended the program by arguing that its goal was simply to correct gender stereotypes and teach students to respect one another. Vincent Peillon, France’s minister of education, argued that the program did not teach that there was no difference between genders or that gender was constructed. There are a certain number of parents, he remarked at the time, “who have allowed themselves to be fooled by a completely false rumor that … at school we are teaching little boys to become little girls. That is absolutely false, and it needs to stop” (all translations mine). The previous year, the minister stated that the idea “that there are no physiological, biological differences” between men and women was “absurd.”

学校官员为这个项目辩护，称其目的仅为纠正性别（gender）刻板印象，并教导学生相互尊重。时任法国教育部长 Vincent Peillon 辩称，该项目并未教导「没有性别差异」或「性别是建构出来的」。他接着说，有一些父母「被一个彻底错误的谣言所愚弄」，觉得「我们在学校里教小男孩变成小女孩」——「根本没有这种事情，刹住谣言」。一年前，该部长也公开声明：「男性和女性之间没有生理学及生物学上的差异」的想法，是「荒谬的」。

But the language of the original program (which has now been replaced bya more “generalized” one) was not as clear as Peillon suggested on the issue of gender. “Gender is a sociological concept,” it states, “that is based on the fact that relations between men and women are socially and culturally constructed. The theory of gender holds that there is a socially constructed sex based on differentiated social roles and stereotypes in addition to anatomical, biological sex, which is innate.” Elsewhere: “Biological differences should not be denied, of course, but those differences should not be a fate.” If sex is innate, how can it also be “socially constructed”? If biological differences are real, what does it mean to say that those differences should not be “a fate”?

然而，原项目（现已被更「笼统」的项目所取代）的语言，在性别议题上，并不像 Vincent Peillon 所暗示的那样清白。「性别（gender）是一个社会学概念，」原项目指出，「这是基于这样一个事实，即男性和女性之间的关系是社会和文化建构起来的。性别（gender）理论认为，除了解剖的、先天的生物学性别之外，还存在一个基于差异化的社会角色以及刻板印象，所建构出来的社会性别（a socially constructed sex）」。原项目中还提到：「当然了，不应否认生物学差异，但这些差异也不该注定一个人的宿命。」然而，如果性别（sex）是先天的，它又如何能是「社会建构」的呢？如果生物学差异是真实的，说这些差异不该「注定一个人的宿命」，又意味着什么呢？

In an article in The Boston Globe, the French protests were dismissed as misinformed and motivated by fear. Judith Butler even suggested that the real cause of the protests was France’s financial instability. Yet, over the past few years, the French have produced a number of well-informed and damning critiques of gender theory. One of the theory’s strongest critics is Alain de Benoist, a philosopher and champion of paganism with a soft spot for the syndicalist socialism of Edouard Berth. In Non à la théorie du genre! (No to Gender Theory) (2014), an extract of his much longer Les démons du bien (The Demons of the Good) (2013), Benoist details the philosophical absurdities and scientific errors of gender theory.

《波士顿环球报》一文中，上述法国家长的抗议被断定只是场由误导信息和恐慌所煽起的闹剧。Judith Butler（朱迪斯·巴特勒）甚至暗示，抗议的真正原因是法国的财政不稳定。可是，在过去几年中，法国产出了许多对性别（gender）理论博闻强识、令人信服的批评。最有力的性别理论批评家之一是 Alain de Benoist——他是哲学家，同时是异教论的拥护者，还有点钟情 Edouard Berth 的工团社会主义（syndicalist socialism）。在他 2014 年的选文 Non à la théorie du genre!（对性别理论说不！），也在他 2013 年 Les démons du bien（《善的魔鬼》）一书中，Alain de Benoist 详细论述了性别理论（gender theory）在哲学上的荒谬和科学上的错误之处。

First, he argues, gender theory rests almost entirely on a terminological confusion. Traditionally, a person’s sex was understood to refer to an aspect of human biology—the end result of the development of a person’s genes. The presence of the SRY gene leads to the development of a male (a person with a penis and other biological attributes of the masculine sex). The absence of SRY leads to the development of a female (a person with an ovary and other biological attributes of the female sex). Gender, in turn, was understood to refer to shared characteristics of each sex. Many of these characteristics (body shape, voice, ways of thinking and acting) are shaped in part by a person’s biological sex, but others are almost entirely shaped by culture. Characteristics determined by culture are neither universal nor immutable and can be used to both oppress and honor individuals or groups.

首先 Alain de Benoist 认为，性别（gender）理论几乎完全建立在术语的混淆之上。传统上，一个人的性别（sex）被理解为指人类生物学的一个方面——一个人基因发展的最终结果。SRY 基因（sex-determining region of Y-chromosome）的存在导致男性的发育（一个有阴茎和其他男性生物学属性的人）；反之，SRY 基因的缺失导致女性的发育（一个有卵巢和其他女性生物学属性的人）。gender，相应地，则被理解为指男女每种性别（sex）的共享特征。其中许多特征（身体体形、嗓音、思维与行为的方式）由一个人的生物性别（biological sex）部分地来塑造，而其他特征几乎全由文化塑造。由文化决定的特征既不是普遍的，也不是永恒不变的；这些特征既可以用来压迫个人或群体，也可以用来给予他们荣誉或尊敬。

According, however, to Judith Butler in Gender Trouble (1990), and most other gender theorists, there is no connection at all between sex and gender (where gender is understood to refer to one’s identity as male or female). Sex “is an analytic attribute of the human; there is no human who is not sexed; sex qualifies the human as a necessary attribute. But sex does not cause gender, and gender cannot be understood to reflect or express sex.” Gender is “always acquired.” In short, a person’s identity as male, female, neither, or both has nothing to do with one’s biological sex (i.e., sex, but I will use this technically redundant phrase for clarity). In “Rethinking Sex and Gender” (1993), Christine Delphy goes a step further. While the idea that “sex precedes gender” is “historically explicable,” she writes, by which I take her to mean that it is a fact, it is an idea that is “theoretically unjustifiable,” and one that is “holding back” gender theorists’ “thinking on gender.”

然而，根据 Judith Butler 1990 年 Gender Trouble（《性别麻烦》）一书的观点，以及大多数性别（gender）理论家的说法，sex 和 gender 之间完全没有联系（这里的 gender 被理解指，认同自己为男性或女性的性别认同）。Sex「作为一种人的分析属性；没有不被性别化（sexed）的人；sex 是人之所以为人的必要属性。但 sex 没有导致 gender，gender 也不能被理解为对 sex 的反映或表达」。Gender「始终是后天获得的」。简言之，一个人作为男性、女性、两者都不是或两者都是的性别认同，与他们的生物性别（biological sex，即 sex，但为清楚起见，我会使用这个技术上冗余的短语）无关。在 1993 年「重新思考 Sex 和 Gender」一文中，Christine Delphy 更进一步。她写出：尽管「sex 先于 gender」的想法是「历史上可解释的」。我理解她的意思是这是一个事实。她接着写，这一想法「在理论上无法证明」，还「阻碍」了性别（gender）理论家「基于 gender 的思考」。

While it is absurd to suggest, as Delphy does, that our gender precedes sex, such a remark is based on the idea that scientific categories are arbitrary. Benoist does not discuss this aspect of gender theory, but it is one that is extrapolated from a partial truth poorly expressed in Jacques Derrida’s “Sign, Structure, and Play in the Discourse of the Human Sciences” (1966), and one worth highlighting. Briefly, Derrida argues that both philosophy and science begin with an assumption or a question that becomes the center for the entire enterprise or structure. “The function of this center,” Derrida writes, is not only to “orient, balance, and organize the structure—one cannot in fact conceive of unorganized structure—but above all to make sure that the organizing principle of the structure would limit what we might call the play of the structure” (emphasis mine). That “play” for Derrida are those ideas or phenomena that don’t quite fit the structure’s “organizing principle.” His point is that philosophy and scientific discourse do not provide exhaustive representations of reality (hardly a news flash, even in 1996). They are merely ways of describing reality—ways that are never complete and always open to revision.

尽管 Christine Delphy 的提议荒谬，即其实我们的 gender 先于 sex，但这样的说法是基于这样一个想法：科学分类是任意主断的（arbitrary）。Alain de Benoist 并未论述性别（gender）理论的这一方面，但它是从雅克·德里达（Jacques Derrida）1966 年「人文科学话语中的结构、符号与嬉戏」（Sign, Structure, and Play in the Discourse of the Human Sciences）中一个表达不清的部分真理推断出来的，这点值得强调。简言之，德里达认为哲学和科学都是以一个假设或问题开始的，这个假设或问题成为整个项目或结构的中心。德里达写道，「这个中心的功能」不仅是「定向、平衡和组织结构——事实上，人们无法想象一个无组织的结构——但最重要的是确保结构的组织原则能限制我们所说的结构的嬉戏」（强调我们的）。对德里达来讲，「嬉戏」是指那些不太符合结构的「组织原则」的想法或现象。他的观点是，哲学和科学话语并没有提供对现实的详尽描述（即使在 1996 年，这也是广为人知的观点）。它们仅仅是描述现实的方式——而这些方式从不完整，且总是开放于修订。

But just because there is more than one way to describe reality does not mean that all descriptions of reality are equally true, a point that Derrida himself may have even acknowledged. So the question is, how much sense does it make to hold that gender “precedes” sex or that sex itself is constructed?

但仅仅因为有不止一种方式来描述现实，并不意味着所有描述现实的方式同样皆真，这一点德里达本人甚至可能都承认。所以问题是，坚持 gender「先于」sex，抑或 sex 本身就是建构出来的，这种观点讲得通吗?

None at all. To believe that sex is constructed is to hold that it is, as Benoist notes, an illusion. Gender theorists espouse this fantastical position because they have taken the uncontroversial observation that some characteristics associated with gender are socially constructed and applied it to biological differences as well. What empirical evidence do they offer that our sex, our identities as male and female, are constructed and not the result of nature? None. That’s because, Benoist writes, quoting Michel Schneider, a member of the Académie française and past Minister of Culture, “We don’t choose our sex, and there are only two.”

根本讲不通。认为 sex 是被建构的，就是认为它是——正如 Benoist 所指出的——一种幻觉。性别（gender）理论家们持有这种异想天开的立场，是因为她们将与 gender 相关的一些特征是由社会建构的，这一毫无争议的观察，也应用到了生物学差异上。她们提供了什么实证证据来证明，我们的 sex、我们作为男性或女性的身份，是建构的，而非大自然的结果？没有。这是因为，Benoist 写道，边引用法兰西学术院、前文化部长 Michel Schneider 的话：「我们不选择自己的性别（sex），而且只有两种」。

Benoist acknowledges that while there are only two sexes, there are a “plurality of practices … or sexual preferences.” It is nonsense to say that biological sex does not determine one’s identity as a man or a woman because that’s exactly what biological sex determines. What it doesn’t determine, Benoist writes, is one’s sexual practices. “The multiplicity of sexual preferences does not make the biological sexes disappear, nor does it increase the number. Sexual orientation, whatever it might be, does not negate the sexed body.”

Benoist 承认，虽然只有两种性别（sex），但存在「多元的实践…… 和性取向」。声称生物性别不决定一个人作为男人或女人的身份是无稽之谈，因为这正是生物性别所决定的。它所决定不了的是，Benoist 写道，一个人的性实践。「性取向的多样性并没有使生物性别消失，也没有增加其数量。性取向，无论是什么，也不能否定性别化（sexed）的身体。」

This gets us to Benoist’s second objection to gender theory. Our biological sex not only causes the human body to develop genitals, but it affects how we think and act in profound ways, without, of course, entirely determining either thought or action. But in refusing to acknowledge that sex has anything to do with gender, gender theorists are forced to deny or ignore increasingly convincing scientific evidence to the contrary. “From the first days of life,” Benoist writes,

这就引出了 Benoist 对性别（gender）理论的第二条反对意见。我们的生物性别不仅导致人体的生殖器官发育，而且还会在——当然，不完全地决定思维和行为方式的情况下，深刻地影响我们的思维和行为方式。但是，由于性别（gender）理论家拒绝承认 sex 与 gender 有任何关系，他们被迫否认和忽视越来越令人信服的相反的科学证据。「从出生的头几天起，」Benoist 写道：

boys look primarily at mechanized objects or objects in movement while girls most often search for visual contact with human faces. Only a few hours after birth, a girl responds to the cries of other infants while a boy shows no interest. The tendency to show empathy is stronger in girls than in boys long before any external influence (or “social expectations”) have been able to assert themselves. At all ages and stages of development, girls are more sensitive to their emotional states and to those of others than boys … From a young age, boys resort to physical strategies where girls turn to verbal ones … From the age of two, boys are more aggressive and take more risks than girls.
男孩主要关注机械物体和运动中的物体，而女孩则更多寻找与人脸的视觉接触。出生后仅几小时，女孩会对其他婴儿的哭声做出反应，而男孩则表现出无兴趣。在任何外部影响（或「社会期望」）施加前，女孩展现同理心的倾向比男孩更强。在所有年龄和发育阶段，女孩对自己和他人的情绪状态比男孩更敏感…… 从小，男孩倾向诉诸肢体策略，而女孩则会诉诸口头策略…… 从两岁开始，男孩比女孩更具攻击性，也更愿意承担风险。

(These are general differences to which there are, of course, exceptions. Nor do such initial tendencies (in young girls, for example, to express empathy, or in boys to take risks) mean that those tendencies are unchangeable. Boys should express empathy, and girls take risks. As noted below, one of the reasons that egalitarianism and gender theory have become so popular is that they take seriously the danger of treating such initial biological dispositions as immutable. However, just because certain initial tendencies are not immutable does not mean that there are no differences between the sexes or that sex is an illusion. Treating it as such, as gender theory does, destroys difference altogether, usually redefining femininity in masculine terms, and ironicially accomplishing the very thing they supposedly set out to combat.)

（这些是一般差异，当然也有例外。也不意味着这些初始倾向(例如，女孩表现同理心，或男孩更愿意冒险)不可改变。男孩应当表现同理心，女孩也应当冒冒险。如下所述，平等主义(egalitarianism，实为“平均主义”)和性别(gender)理论之所以变得如此流行的一部分原因，就在于她们(那些性别理论家们)严肃对待这样初始的生物上的性格倾向，并将其视作不可改变的危险之物。然而，仅仅因为某些初始的倾向并非不可改变，也不意味着男女性别(sexes)间没有差异，或者性别(sex)是一种幻觉。将其视为幻觉，正如性别(gender)理论所作的，就是完全摧毁了差异，通常还是用阳刚的(masculine，男子气概的)术语来重定义女子气质(femininity)，具有讽刺意味地实现了她们所声称要反对的事情。）

Our brains are sexed. Benoist writes that “the hormonal impregnation of the fetus has a direct affect on the organization of neural circuits, creating a masculine brain and a feminine brain, which can be distinguished by a variety of anatomical, physiological and biochemical markers.”

我们的大脑是性别化（sexed）的。Benoist 写道，「激素在胎儿期的渗透会直接影响神经回路的组织，从而形成男性化和女性化的大脑，两者可通过各种解剖学、生理学和生化学标记加以区分。」

Even our cells are sexed. According to David C. Page, director of The Whitehead Institute at MIT, “Throughout human bodies, the cells of males and females are biochemically different,” which affects, among other things, how men and women contract and fight diseases.

甚至连我们的细胞也是性别化（sexed）的。麻省理工学院 Whitehead Institute 的前所长，David C. Page 说，「在整个人体内，男性和女性的细胞在生化上存在差异，」这会影响许多事情，包括男性和女性对疾病的感染和抵抗方式。

A common response to the above is to suggest that such remarks are “sexist.” But this view is based on an egalitarian feminism that, as Benoist puts it, defines “equality” as “sameness” and is, in turn, distinctly anti-feminine:

对上述言论的一种常见反应是指出此类论调是「性别歧视」。但这种反击是基于一种平等主义的女权主义（egalitarian feminism）的，正如 Benoist 所指，这种主义将「平等」定义为「相同」，而这反过来，又明显地反女性：

Understanding equality as sameness alone, [gender theory] follows the modern ideal: society is supposed to consist of self-sufficient subjects, without any engagement or mutual attachment other than those made by the will, reason, or contract. Its credo is that women must ‘understand their identity as determined by liberty and not as the result of belonging [to a particular group]’ (Danièle Sallenave)—which is to say, that they should avoid thinking of themselves as women at all costs.
单纯将平等理解为相同，[性别(gender)理论] 遵循着如下的现代理想：社会应当只由自给自足（self-sufficient）的个体组成，除了意志、理性或契约建立的联系之外，不应有其他任何参与或相互依附。其信条是，女性必须「理解她们的身份是由自由（liberty）决定的，而非属于 [一个特定群体] 的结果」(Danièle Sallenave)——也就是说，她们应该不惜一切代价避免将自己视为女性。

The idea that equality requires sameness developed from Derrida’s idea that binary categorization (presence/absence, masculine/feminine) always leads to a hierarchy in which one term dominates the other. In order to combat this supposedly “violent” hierarchy, feminists like Butler and others battled difference itself. In 2001, Monique Wittig wrote that we need to “destroy—politically, philosophically, symbolically—the categories ‘man’ and ‘woman’.” The irony, however, is that it is rarely masculinity that is destroyed in egalitarian feminism. What most often happens is that femininity is redefined in masculine terms. To be a real woman in the egalitarian view is to act like a man. In this sense, popular discourse to the contrary, egalitarian feminism has almost no interest in “diversity” because it is founded on the idea that difference—even biological difference—must be destroyed.

「平等需要相同」这种想法来源于德里达的观点，即二元分类（在场/缺席，阳性的(男子气概的)/阴性的(女子气质的)）总是会导致一种等级制，其中一端的术语的权力主导着另一端。为了对抗这种「暴力的」等级制，像 Judith Butler 等的女权主义者与差异本身作斗争。2001 年，Monique Wittig（莫尼克·维蒂格）写道，我们需要「在政治上、哲学上和符号象征上——摧毁——『男人』和『女人』这两个类别」。然而，讽刺的是，在平等主义的女权主义中被摧毁的很少是男子气概（masculinity）。最常发生的情况是，女子气质（femininity）被以阳刚的（masculine，男子气概的）术语来重定义。在平等主义看来，要想成为一个真正的女人，就意味着得像男人那样行事。从这个意义上讲，与流行话语相反，平等主义的女权主义几乎对「多样性」不感兴趣，因为它建立在这样一个观念上——即使是生物学差异——也必须被摧毁。

Benoist’s explanation of where this sort of radical egalitarianism came from and how it became so popular is intriguing but somewhat less convincing. (In Les démons du bien he argues, if I understand him correctly, that it is the result of Christianity [perhaps wrongly understood, though he is somewhat unclear on this], capitalism and a bastardized Marxism.) His criticism of gender theory, however—its equivocations, errors, and absurdities—is one of the best and most extensive to date.

Benoist 对这种激进平等主义从何而来，以及为何变得如此流行的解释非常有趣，但稍微没我们所讲的正题那般令人信服。（在 Les démons du bien (《善的魔鬼》) 一书中，他认为，如果我理解正确的话，这是基督教 [也许是我的误解，尽管他在此也描述得不太清楚]、资本主义和被歪曲的马克思主义的结果。）然而，他对性别（gender）理论的批评——其模棱、错误及荒谬之处——是迄今为止最好、最全面的。

Micah Mattix (Ph.D., 弗里堡大学)，曾在耶鲁大学、北卡罗来纳大学教堂山分校和休斯顿浸会大学任教，后加入伦敦摄政大学。他定期为 The Wall Street Journal 撰稿，并编辑有关书籍、艺术和思想的每日通讯 Prufrock。

2.289 0 0 0-1.665-1.665Z"></path></svg></a></span>」/「性别」——但这种区分似乎助长了 <i>gender</i> 的荒谬地位。故这里<b>有意混淆</b> <i>sex</i> / <i>gender</i>，<b>通译为「性别」，或直接用英文表达</b>。还请读者适当地中英对照。</blockquote><p data-pid="Y-gZ_X-E">In May 2013, François Hollande <a href="https://link.zhihu.com/?target=http%3A//www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-22579093" class=" wrap external" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer" data-za-detail-view-id="1043">signed a controversial bill</a> that made France the ninth country in Europe and the fourteenth in the world to legalize gay marriage. A little over six months later, news that a program called l’ABCD de l’égalité (the ABCs of Egality) was being introduced to six hundred French elementary schools sparked <a href="https://link.zhihu.com/?target=http%3A//www.france24.com/en/20140129-france-sex-education-gender-discrimination-protest-school/" class=" wrap external" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer" data-za-detail-view-id="1043">widespread protests</a> after parents were told that it taught that gender was simply a construct of social customs.</p><p data-pid="VheP5rLj">2013 年 5 月，<span><a class="RichContent-EntityWord css-b7erz1" data-za-not-track-link="true" data-paste-text="true" href="https://zhida.zhihu.com/search?content_id=239253325&content_type=Article&match_order=1&q=%E5%BC%97%E6%9C%97%E7%B4%A2%E7%93%A6%C2%B7%E5%A5%A5%E6%9C%97%E5%BE%B7&zhida_source=entity" target="_blank">弗朗索瓦·奥朗德<svg width="10px" height="10px" viewBox="0 0 16 16" class="ZDI ZDI--FourPointedStar16 css-1dvsrp" fill="currentColor"><path d="m5.068 9.267-3.08-.77a.512.512 0 0 1 0-.994l3.08-.77a2.289 2.289 0 0 0 1.665-1.665l.77-3.08a.512.512 0 0 1 .994 0l.77 3.08c.205.82.845 1.46 1.665 1.665l3.08.77a.512.512 0 0 1 0 .994l-3.08.77a2.29 2.29 0 0 0-1.665 1.665l-.77 3.08a.512.512 0 0 1-.994 0l-.77-3.08a2.289 2.289 0 0 0-1.665-1.665Z"></path></svg></a></span>签署了一项有争议的法案，使法国成为欧洲第九个、世界第十四个将同性婚姻合法化的国家。就在六个多月后，一项名为「DE l’égalité de ABC」（平等的 ABC 们）的项目被引入法国 600 多所小学的消息引发了广泛抗议，原因是，家长们被告知，它会教导孩子们性别（gender）仅仅是社会习俗的建构。</p><p data-pid="gygKqKJv">School officials defended the program by arguing that its goal was simply <a href="https://link.zhihu.com/?target=http%3A//www.lepoint.fr/societe/abcd-de-l-egalite-qu-est-ce-que-c-est-exactement-30-01-2014-1786170_23.php" class=" wrap external" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer" data-za-detail-view-id="1043">to correct gender stereotypes</a> and teach students to respect one another. Vincent Peillon, France’s minister of education, argued that the program did not teach that there was no difference between genders or that gender was constructed. There are a certain number of parents, he <a href="https://link.zhihu.com/?target=http%3A//www.leparisien.fr/laparisienne/societe/vincent-peillon-dement-l-enseignement-de-la-theorie-du-genre-a-l-ecole-28-01-2014-3536417.php" class=" wrap external" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer" data-za-detail-view-id="1043">remarked at the time</a>, “who have allowed themselves to be fooled by a completely false rumor that … at school we are teaching little boys to become little girls. That is absolutely false, and it needs to stop” (all translations mine). The previous year, the minister <a href="https://link.zhihu.com/?target=http%3A//www.liberation.fr/societe/2013/06/10/la-theorie-du-genre-reponse-au-ministre-vincent-peillon_909686" class=" wrap external" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer" data-za-detail-view-id="1043">stated</a> that the idea “that there are no physiological, biological differences” between men and women was “absurd.”</p><p data-pid="6fnaTME9">学校官员为这个项目辩护，称其目的仅为纠正性别（gender）刻板印象，并教导学生相互尊重。时任法国教育部长 Vincent Peillon 辩称，该项目并未教导「没有性别差异」或「性别是建构出来的」。他接着说，有一些父母「被一个彻底错误的谣言所愚弄」，觉得「我们在学校里教小男孩变成小女孩」——「根本没有这种事情，刹住谣言」。一年前，该部长也公开声明：「男性和女性之间没有生理学及生物学上的差异」的想法，是「荒谬的」。</p><p data-pid="nmVIphlu">But the <a href="https://link.zhihu.com/?target=http%3A//www.la-croix.com/Actualite/France/Ce-que-dit-l-ABCD-de-l-egalite-2014-02-05-1101997" class=" wrap external" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer" data-za-detail-view-id="1043">language of the original program</a> (which has now been replaced bya more “generalized” one) was not as clear as Peillon suggested on the issue of gender. “Gender is a sociological concept,” it states, “that is based on the fact that relations between men and women are socially and culturally constructed. The theory of gender holds that there is a socially constructed sex based on differentiated social roles and stereotypes in addition to anatomical, biological sex, which is innate.” Elsewhere: “Biological differences should not be denied, of course, but those differences should not be a fate.” If sex is innate, how can it also be “socially constructed”? If biological differences are real, what does it mean to say that those differences should not be “a fate”?</p><p data-pid="gjHcgbX3">然而，原项目（现已被更「笼统」的项目所取代）的语言，在性别议题上，并不像 Vincent Peillon 所暗示的那样清白。「性别（gender）是一个社会学概念，」原项目指出，「这是基于这样一个事实，即男性和女性之间的关系是社会和文化建构起来的。性别（gender）理论认为，除了解剖的、先天的生物学性别之外，还存在一个基于差异化的社会角色以及刻板印象，所建构出来的社会性别（a socially constructed sex）」。原项目中还提到：「当然了，不应否认生物学差异，但这些差异也不该注定一个人的宿命。」然而，如果性别（sex）是先天的，它又如何能是「社会建构」的呢？如果生物学差异是真实的，说这些差异不该「注定一个人的宿命」，又意味着什么呢？</p><p data-pid="uU9131-y">In an article in <i>The Boston Globe</i>, the French protests were dismissed as <a href="https://link.zhihu.com/?target=http%3A//www.bostonglobe.com/ideas/2014/03/02/how-you-upset-french-gender-theory/1DzXUKcQxB01Hv6pN96gvJ/story.html" class=" wrap external" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer">misinformed and motivated by fear</a>. <span><a class="RichContent-EntityWord css-b7erz1" data-za-not-track-link="true" data-paste-text="true" href="https://zhida.zhihu.com/search?content_id=239253325&content_type=Article&match_order=1&q=Judith+Butler&zhida_source=entity" target="_blank">Judith Butler<svg width="10px" height="10px" viewBox="0 0 16 16" class="ZDI ZDI--FourPointedStar16 css-1dvsrp" fill="currentColor"><path d="m5.068 9.267-3.08-.77a.512.512 0 0 1 0-.994l3.08-.77a2.289 2.289 0 0 0 1.665-1.665l.77-3.08a.512.512 0 0 1 .994 0l.77 3.08c.205.82.845 1.46 1.665 1.665l3.08.77a.512.512 0 0 1 0 .994l-3.08.77a2.29 2.29 0 0 0-1.665 1.665l-.77 3.08a.512.512 0 0 1-.994 0l-.77-3.08a2.289 2.289 0 0 0-1.665-1.665Z"></path></svg></a></span> even suggested that the real cause of the protests was France’s financial instability. Yet, over the past few years, the French have produced a number of well-informed and damning critiques of gender theory. One of the theory’s strongest critics is <span><a class="RichContent-EntityWord css-b7erz1" data-za-not-track-link="true" data-paste-text="true" href="https://zhida.zhihu.com/search?content_id=239253325&content_type=Article&match_order=1&q=Alain+de+Benoist&zhida_source=entity" target="_blank">Alain de Benoist<svg width="10px" height="10px" viewBox="0 0 16 16" class="ZDI ZDI--FourPointedStar16 css-1dvsrp" fill="currentColor"><path d="m5.068 9.267-3.08-.77a.512.512 0 0 1 0-.994l3.08-.77a2.289 2.289 0 0 0 1.665-1.665l.77-3.08a.512.512 0 0 1 .994 0l.77 3.08c.205.82.845 1.46 1.665 1.665l3.08.77a.512.512 0 0 1 0 .994l-3.08.77a2.29 2.29 0 0 0-1.665 1.665l-.77 3.08a.512.512 0 0 1-.994 0l-.77-3.08a2.289 2.289 0 0 0-1.665-1.665Z"></path></svg></a></span>, a philosopher and champion of paganism with a soft spot for the syndicalist socialism of Edouard Berth. In <i>Non à la théorie du genre!</i> (<i>No to Gender Theory</i>) (2014), an extract of his much longer <i>Les démons du bien</i> (<i>The Demons of the Good</i>) (2013), Benoist details the philosophical absurdities and scientific errors of gender theory.</p><p data-pid="3RcmHP0q">《波士顿环球报》一文中，上述法国家长的抗议被断定只是场由误导信息和恐慌所煽起的闹剧。Judith Butler（朱迪斯·巴特勒）甚至暗示，抗议的真正原因是法国的财政不稳定。可是，在过去几年中，法国产出了许多对性别（gender）理论博闻强识、令人信服的批评。最有力的性别理论批评家之一是 Alain de Benoist——他是哲学家，同时是异教论的拥护者，还有点钟情 Edouard Berth 的工团社会主义（syndicalist socialism）。在他 2014 年的选文 <i>Non à la théorie du genre!</i>（对性别理论说不！），也在他 2013 年 <i>Les démons du bien</i>（《善的魔鬼》）一书中，Alain de Benoist 详细论述了性别理论（gender theory）在哲学上的荒谬和科学上的错误之处。</p><p data-pid="CBFnF_4g">First, he argues, gender theory rests almost entirely on a terminological confusion. Traditionally, a person’s sex was understood to refer to an aspect of human biology—the end result of the development of a person’s genes. The <a href="https://link.zhihu.com/?target=http%3A//www.nature.com/nature/journal/v453/n7197/full/nature06944.html" class=" wrap external" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer">presence of the SRY gene</a> leads to the development of a male (a person with a penis and other biological attributes of the masculine sex). The absence of SRY leads to the development of a female (a person with an ovary and other biological attributes of the female sex). Gender, in turn, was understood to refer to shared characteristics of each sex. Many of these characteristics (body shape, voice, ways of thinking and acting) are shaped in part by a person’s biological sex, but others are almost entirely shaped by culture. Characteristics determined by culture are neither universal nor immutable and can be used to both oppress and honor individuals or groups.</p><p data-pid="gop6cyU2">首先 Alain de Benoist 认为，性别（gender）理论几乎完全建立在术语的混淆之上。传统上，一个人的性别（sex）被理解为指人类生物学的一个方面——一个人基因发展的最终结果。SRY 基因（<i><b>s</b>ex-determining <b>r</b>egion of <b>Y</b>-chromosome</i>）的存在导致男性的发育（一个有阴茎和其他男性生物学属性的人）；反之，SRY 基因的缺失导致女性的发育（一个有卵巢和其他女性生物学属性的人）。gender，相应地，则被理解为指男女每种性别（sex）的共享特征。其中许多特征（身体体形、嗓音、思维与行为的方式）由一个人的生物性别（biological sex）部分地来塑造，而其他特征几乎全由文化塑造。由文化决定的特征既不是普遍的，也不是永恒不变的；这些特征既可以用来压迫个人或群体，也可以用来给予他们荣誉或尊敬。</p><p data-pid="lnmeoOAH">According, however, to Judith Butler in <i>Gender Trouble</i> (1990), and most other gender theorists, there is no connection at all between sex and gender (where gender is understood to refer to one’s identity as male or female). Sex “is an analytic attribute of the human; there is no human who is not sexed; sex qualifies the human as a necessary attribute. But sex does not cause gender, and gender cannot be understood to reflect or express sex.” Gender is “always acquired.” In short, a person’s identity as male, female, neither, or both has nothing to do with one’s biological sex (i.e., sex, but I will use this technically redundant phrase for clarity). In “<a href="https://link.zhihu.com/?target=http%3A//www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/027753959390076L" class=" wrap external" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer">Rethinking Sex and Gender</a>” (1993), <span><a class="RichContent-EntityWord css-b7erz1" data-za-not-track-link="true" data-paste-text="true" href="https://zhida.zhihu.com/search?content_id=239253325&content_type=Article&match_order=1&q=Christine+Delphy&zhida_source=entity" target="_blank">Christine Delphy<svg width="10px" height="10px" viewBox="0 0 16 16" class="ZDI ZDI--FourPointedStar16 css-1dvsrp" fill="currentColor"><path d="m5.068 9.267-3.08-.77a.512.512 0 0 1 0-.994l3.08-.77a2.289 2.289 0 0 0 1.665-1.665l.77-3.08a.512.512 0 0 1 .994 0l.77 3.08c.205.82.845 1.46 1.665 1.665l3.08.77a.512.512 0 0 1 0 .994l-3.08.77a2.29 2.29 0 0 0-1.665 1.665l-.77 3.08a.512.512 0 0 1-.994 0l-.77-3.08a2.289 2.289 0 0 0-1.665-1.665Z"></path></svg></a></span> goes a step further. While the idea that “sex precedes gender” is “historically explicable,” she writes, by which I take her to mean that it is a fact, it is an idea that is “theoretically unjustifiable,” and one that is “holding back” gender theorists’ “thinking on gender.”</p><p data-pid="jSlo5YG0">然而，根据 Judith Butler 1990 年 <i>Gender Trouble</i>（《性别麻烦》）一书的观点，以及大多数性别（gender）理论家的说法，sex 和 gender 之间完全没有联系（这里的 gender 被理解指，认同自己为男性或女性的性别认同）。Sex「作为一种人的分析属性；没有不被性别化（sexed）的人；sex 是人之所以为人的必要属性。但 sex 没有导致 gender，gender 也不能被理解为对 sex 的反映或表达」。Gender「始终是后天获得的」。简言之，一个人作为男性、女性、两者都不是或两者都是的性别认同，与他们的生物性别（biological sex，即 sex，但为清楚起见，我会使用这个技术上冗余的短语）无关。在 1993 年「重新思考 Sex 和 Gender」一文中，Christine Delphy 更进一步。她写出：尽管「sex 先于 gender」的想法是「历史上可解释的」。我理解她的意思是这是一个事实。她接着写，这一想法「在理论上无法证明」，还「阻碍」了性别（gender）理论家「基于 gender 的思考」。</p><p data-pid="cJLxwOSa">While it is absurd to suggest, as Delphy does, that our gender precedes sex, such a remark is based on the idea that scientific categories are arbitrary. Benoist does not discuss this aspect of gender theory, but it is one that is extrapolated from a partial truth poorly expressed in Jacques Derrida’s “Sign, Structure, and Play in the Discourse of the Human Sciences” (1966), and one worth highlighting. Briefly, Derrida argues that both philosophy and science begin with an assumption or a question that becomes the center for the entire enterprise or structure. “The function of this center,” Derrida writes, is not only to “orient, balance, and organize the structure—one cannot in fact conceive of unorganized structure—but above all <i>to make sure that the organizing principle of the structure would limit what we might call the play of the structure</i>” (emphasis mine). That “play” for Derrida are those ideas or phenomena that don’t quite fit the structure’s “organizing principle.” His point is that philosophy and scientific discourse do not provide exhaustive representations of reality (hardly a news flash, even in 1996). They are merely <i>ways</i> of describing reality—ways that are never complete and always open to revision.</p><p data-pid="V7m2i2j7">尽管 Christine Delphy 的提议荒谬，即其实我们的 gender 先于 sex，但这样的说法是基于这样一个想法：科学分类是任意主断的（arbitrary）。Alain de Benoist 并未论述性别（gender）理论的这一方面，但它是从<span><a class="RichContent-EntityWord css-b7erz1" data-za-not-track-link="true" data-paste-text="true" href="https://zhida.zhihu.com/search?content_id=239253325&content_type=Article&match_order=1&q=%E9%9B%85%E5%85%8B%C2%B7%E5%BE%B7%E9%87%8C%E8%BE%BE&zhida_source=entity" target="_blank">雅克·德里达<svg width="10px" height="10px" viewBox="0 0 16 16" class="ZDI ZDI--FourPointedStar16 css-1dvsrp" fill="currentColor"><path d="m5.068 9.267-3.08-.77a.512.512 0 0 1 0-.994l3.08-.77a2.289 2.289 0 0 0 1.665-1.665l.77-3.08a.512.512 0 0 1 .994 0l.77 3.08c.205.82.845 1.46 1.665 1.665l3.08.77a.512.512 0 0 1 0 .994l-3.08.77a2.29 2.29 0 0 0-1.665 1.665l-.77 3.08a.512.512 0 0 1-.994 0l-.77-3.08a2.289 2.289 0 0 0-1.665-1.665Z"></path></svg></a></span>（Jacques Derrida）1966 年「人文科学话语中的结构、符号与嬉戏」（Sign, Structure, and Play in the Discourse of the Human Sciences）中一个表达不清的部分真理推断出来的，这点值得强调。简言之，德里达认为哲学和科学都是以一个假设或问题开始的，这个假设或问题成为整个项目或结构的中心。德里达写道，「这个中心的功能」不仅是「定向、平衡和组织结构——事实上，人们无法想象一个无组织的结构——但最重要的是<i>确保结构的组织原则能限制<b>我们</b>所说的结构的嬉戏</i>」（强调我们的）。对德里达来讲，「嬉戏」是指那些不太符合结构的「组织原则」的想法或现象。他的观点是，哲学和科学话语并没有提供对现实的详尽描述（即使在 1996 年，这也是广为人知的观点）。它们仅仅是描述现实的<i><b>方式</b></i>——而这些方式从不完整，且总是开放于修订。</p><p data-pid="jCgq7X3k">But just because there is more than one way to describe reality does not mean that <i>all descriptions of reality are equally true</i>, a point that Derrida himself <a href="https://link.zhihu.com/?target=http%3A//pmc.iath.virginia.edu/text-only/issue.197/plotnitsky.197" class=" wrap external" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer">may have even acknowledged</a>. So the question is, how much sense does it make to hold that gender “precedes” sex or that sex itself is constructed?</p><p data-pid="QpR_2Btu">但仅仅因为有不止一种方式来描述现实，<b>并不意味着<i>所有描述现实的方式同样皆真</i></b>，这一点德里达本人甚至可能都承认。所以问题是，坚持 gender「先于」sex，抑或 sex 本身就是建构出来的，这种观点讲得通吗?</p><p data-pid="-06xl01d">None at all. To believe that sex is constructed is to hold that it is, as Benoist notes, an illusion. Gender theorists espouse this fantastical position because they have taken the uncontroversial observation that <i>some</i> characteristics associated with gender are socially constructed and applied it to biological differences as well. What empirical evidence do they offer that our sex, our identities as male and female, are constructed and not the result of nature? None. That’s because, Benoist writes, quoting Michel Schneider, a member of the Académie française and past Minister of Culture, “We don’t choose our sex, and there are only two.”</p><p data-pid="aE7ihgkQ">根本讲不通。认为 sex 是被建构的，就是认为它是——正如 Benoist 所指出的——一种幻觉。性别（gender）理论家们持有这种异想天开的立场，是因为她们将与 gender 相关的<i><b>一些</b></i>特征是由社会建构的，这一毫无争议的观察，也应用到了生物学差异上。她们提供了什么实证证据来证明，我们的 sex、我们作为男性或女性的身份，是建构的，而非大自然的结果？没有。这是因为，Benoist 写道，边引用法兰西学术院、前文化部长 Michel Schneider 的话：「我们不选择自己的性别（sex），而且只有两种」。</p><p data-pid="EXSFmI-J">Benoist acknowledges that while there are only two sexes, there are a “plurality of practices … or sexual preferences.” It is nonsense to say that biological sex does not determine one’s identity as a man or a woman because that’s <i>exactly</i> what biological sex determines. What it doesn’t determine, Benoist writes, is one’s sexual practices. “The multiplicity of sexual preferences does not make the biological sexes disappear, nor does it increase the number. Sexual orientation, whatever it might be, does not negate the sexed body.”</p><p data-pid="hbViwTpr">Benoist 承认，虽然只有两种性别（sex），但存在「多元的实践…… 和性取向」。声称生物性别不决定一个人作为男人或女人的身份是无稽之谈，因为这<i><b>正是</b></i>生物性别所决定的。它所决定不了的是，Benoist 写道，一个人的性实践。「性取向的多样性并没有使生物性别消失，也没有增加其数量。性取向，无论是什么，也不能否定性别化（sexed）的身体。」</p><p data-pid="l5cWUPIT">This gets us to Benoist’s second objection to gender theory. Our biological sex not only causes the human body to develop genitals, but it affects how we think and act in profound ways, without, of course, entirely determining either thought or action. But in refusing to acknowledge that sex has anything to do with gender, gender theorists are forced to deny or ignore increasingly convincing scientific evidence to the contrary. “From the first days of life,” Benoist writes,</p><p data-pid="zOkxuFOo">这就引出了 Benoist 对性别（gender）理论的第二条反对意见。我们的生物性别不仅导致人体的生殖器官发育，而且还会在——当然，不完全地决定思维和行为方式的情况下，深刻地影响我们的思维和行为方式。但是，由于性别（gender）理论家拒绝承认 sex 与 gender 有任何关系，他们被迫否认和忽视越来越令人信服的相反的科学证据。「从出生的头几天起，」Benoist 写道：</p><blockquote data-pid="JgjKhigr">boys look primarily at mechanized objects or objects in movement while girls most often search for visual contact with human faces. Only a few hours after birth, a girl responds to the cries of other infants while a boy shows no interest. The tendency to show empathy is stronger in girls than in boys long before any external influence (or “social expectations”) have been able to assert themselves. At all ages and stages of development, girls are more sensitive to their emotional states and to those of others than boys … From a young age, boys resort to physical strategies where girls turn to verbal ones … From the age of two, boys are more aggressive and take more risks than girls.<br>男孩主要关注机械物体和运动中的物体，而女孩则更多寻找与人脸的视觉接触。出生后仅几小时，女孩会对其他婴儿的哭声做出反应，而男孩则表现出无兴趣。在任何外部影响（或「社会期望」）施加前，女孩展现同理心的倾向比男孩更强。在所有年龄和发育阶段，女孩对自己和他人的情绪状态比男孩更敏感…… 从小，男孩倾向诉诸肢体策略，而女孩则会诉诸口头策略…… 从两岁开始，男孩比女孩更具攻击性，也更愿意承担风险。</blockquote><p data-pid="ijt4arUA">(These are <i>general</i> differences to which there are, of course, exceptions. Nor do such initial tendencies (in young girls, for example, to express empathy, or in boys to take risks) mean that those tendencies are unchangeable. Boys should express empathy, and girls take risks. As noted below, one of the reasons that egalitarianism and gender theory have become so popular is that they take seriously the danger of treating such <i>initial</i> biological dispositions as immutable. However, just because certain initial tendencies are not immutable does not mean that there are no differences between the sexes or that sex is an illusion. Treating it as such, as gender theory does, destroys difference altogether, usually redefining femininity in masculine terms, and ironicially accomplishing the very thing they supposedly set out to combat.)</p><p data-pid="QQ1znZ7L">（这些是<i><b>一般</b></i>差异，当然也有例外。也不意味着这些初始倾向(例如，女孩表现同理心，或男孩更愿意冒险)不可改变。男孩应当表现同理心，女孩也应当冒冒险。如下所述，平等主义(egalitarianism，实为“平均主义”)和性别(gender)理论之所以变得如此流行的一部分原因，就在于她们(那些性别理论家们)严肃对待这样<i><b>初始的</b></i>生物上的性格倾向，并将其视作不可改变的危险之物。然而，仅仅因为某些初始的倾向并非不可改变，也不意味着男女性别(sexes)间没有差异，或者性别(sex)是一种幻觉。将其视为幻觉，正如性别(gender)理论所作的，就是完全摧毁了差异，通常还是用阳刚的(masculine，男子气概的)术语来重定义女子气质(femininity)，具有讽刺意味地实现了她们所声称要反对的事情。）</p><p data-pid="-WJ9kAGk">Our brains are sexed. Benoist writes that “the hormonal impregnation of the fetus has a direct affect on the organization of neural circuits, creating a masculine brain and a feminine brain, which can be distinguished by a variety of anatomical, physiological and biochemical markers.”</p><p data-pid="qvarRat_">我们的大脑是性别化（sexed）的。Benoist 写道，「激素在胎儿期的渗透会直接影响神经回路的组织，从而形成男性化和女性化的大脑，两者可通过各种解剖学、生理学和生化学标记加以区分。」</p><p data-pid="YXBS4qve">Even our cells are sexed. <a href="https://link.zhihu.com/?target=http%3A//www.nytimes.com/2014/04/24/science/researchers-see-new-importance-for-y-chromosome.html" class=" wrap external" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noreferrer">According to David C. Page</a>, director of The Whitehead Institute at MIT, “Throughout human bodies, the cells of males and females are biochemically different,” which affects, among other things, how men and women contract and fight diseases.</p><p data-pid="0Kgv-CGT">甚至连我们的细胞也是性别化（sexed）的。麻省理工学院 Whitehead Institute 的前所长，David C. Page 说，「在整个人体内，男性和女性的细胞在生化上存在差异，」这会影响许多事情，包括男性和女性对疾病的感染和抵抗方式。</p><p data-pid="QWsoABsD">A common response to the above is to suggest that such remarks are “sexist.” But this view is based on an egalitarian feminism that, as Benoist puts it, defines “equality” as “sameness” and is, in turn, distinctly anti-feminine:</p><p data-pid="q2kgaYhN">对上述言论的一种常见反应是指出此类论调是「性别歧视」。但这种反击是基于一种平等主义的女权主义（egalitarian feminism）的，正如 Benoist 所指，这种主义将「平等」定义为「相同」，而这反过来，又明显地反女性：</p><blockquote data-pid="dhsPeTsX">Understanding equality as sameness alone, [gender theory] follows the modern ideal: society is supposed to consist of self-sufficient subjects, without any engagement or mutual attachment other than those made by the will, reason, or contract. Its credo is that women must ‘understand their identity as determined by liberty and not as the result of belonging [to a particular group]’ (Danièle Sallenave)—which is to say, that they should avoid thinking of themselves as women at all costs.<br>单纯将平等理解为相同，[性别(gender)理论] 遵循着如下的现代理想：社会应当只由自给自足（self-sufficient）的个体组成，除了意志、理性或契约建立的联系之外，不应有其他任何参与或相互依附。其信条是，女性必须「理解她们的身份是由自由（liberty）决定的，而非属于 [一个特定群体] 的结果」(Danièle Sallenave)——也就是说，她们应该不惜一切代价避免将自己视为女性。</blockquote><p data-pid="AxU9XRoI">The idea that equality requires sameness developed from Derrida’s idea that binary categorization (presence/absence, masculine/feminine) always leads to a hierarchy in which one term dominates the other. In order to combat this supposedly “violent” hierarchy, feminists like Butler and others battled difference itself. In 2001, Monique Wittig wrote that we need to “destroy—politically, philosophically, symbolically—the categories ‘man’ and ‘woman’.” The irony, however, is that it is rarely masculinity that is destroyed in egalitarian feminism. What most often happens is that femininity is redefined in masculine terms. To be a <i>real</i> woman in the egalitarian view is to act like a man. In this sense, popular discourse to the contrary, egalitarian feminism has almost no interest in “diversity” because it is founded on the idea that difference—even biological difference—must be destroyed.</p><p data-pid="wpiA6iAC">「平等需要相同」这种想法来源于德里达的观点，即二元分类（在场/缺席，阳性的(男子气概的)/阴性的(女子气质的)）总是会导致一种等级制，其中一端的术语的权力主导着另一端。为了对抗这种「暴力的」等级制，像 Judith Butler 等的女权主义者与差异本身作斗争。2001 年，Monique Wittig（莫尼克·维蒂格）写道，我们需要「在政治上、哲学上和符号象征上——摧毁——『男人』和『女人』这两个类别」。然而，讽刺的是，在平等主义的女权主义中被摧毁的很少是男子气概（masculinity）。最常发生的情况是，女子气质（femininity）被以阳刚的（masculine，男子气概的）术语来重定义。在平等主义看来，要想成为一个<i><b>真正的</b></i>女人，就意味着得像男人那样行事。从这个意义上讲，与流行话语相反，平等主义的女权主义几乎对「多样性」不感兴趣，因为它建立在这样一个观念上——即使是生物学差异——也必须被摧毁。</p><p data-pid="ozqYD4Qy">Benoist’s explanation of where this sort of radical egalitarianism came from and how it became so popular is intriguing but somewhat less convincing. (In <i>Les démons du bien</i> he argues, if I understand him correctly, that it is the result of Christianity [perhaps wrongly understood, though he is somewhat unclear on this], capitalism and a bastardized Marxism.) His criticism of gender theory, however—its equivocations, errors, and absurdities—is one of the best and most extensive to date.</p><p data-pid="qK1m0u8t">Benoist 对这种激进平等主义从何而来，以及为何变得如此流行的解释非常有趣，但稍微没我们所讲的正题那般令人信服。（在 <i>Les démons du bien (</i>《善的魔鬼》) 一书中，他认为，如果我理解正确的话，这是基督教 [也许是我的误解，尽管他在此也描述得不太清楚]、资本主义和被歪曲的马克思主义的结果。）然而，他对性别（gender）理论的批评——其模棱、错误及荒谬之处——是迄今为止最好、最全面的。</p><blockquote data-pid="M6Lrkxf9">Micah Mattix (Ph.D., 弗里堡大学)，曾在耶鲁大学、北卡罗来纳大学教堂山分校和休斯顿浸会大学任教，后加入伦敦摄政大学。他定期为 theory，本身就是建立在刻板印象上的，反而这才是一种幻觉。真正应该做的是承认客观生物学、生理学基础上的性别及随之而来的性别差异，不鼓励男女发展出任何对应的刻板印象（“男的要阳刚，女的要阴柔”），然而，男女两性各自表现出来的所有性征和性格特点，不管在当今社会多么不符合潮流，都应视为男女本质的外延。故当今社会的跨性别并没有真正的跨“性别”，只是在跨stereotype罢了。就像未来机器人热情、友好得再像人，人却冷漠得像冰冷的机器人，机器人也不可能成为人，也不应该在此刻板印象上认同机器人是人，人反而是机器人。</p></div><div data-pid=\"Y-gZ_X-E\"\u003EIn May 2013, François Hollande \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Flink.zhihu.com\u002F?target=http%3A\u002F\u002Fwww.bbc.com\u002Fnews\u002Fworld-europe-22579093\" class=\" wrap external\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"\u003Esigned a controversial bill\u003C\u002Fa\u003E that made France the ninth country in Europe and the fourteenth in the world to legalize gay marriage. A little over six months later, news that a program called l’ABCD de l’égalité (the ABCs of Egality) was being introduced to six hundred French elementary schools sparked \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Flink.zhihu.com\u002F?target=http%3A\u002F\u002Fwww.france24.com\u002Fen\u002F20140129-france-sex-education-gender-discrimination-protest-school\u002F\" class=\" wrap external\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"\u003Ewidespread protests\u003C\u002Fa\u003E after parents were told that it taught that gender was simply a construct of social customs.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"VheP5rLj\"\u003E2013 年 5 月，弗朗索瓦·奥朗德签署了一项有争议的法案，使法国成为欧洲第九个、世界第十四个将同性婚姻合法化的国家。就在六个多月后，一项名为「DE l’égalité de ABC」（平等的 ABC 们）的项目被引入法国 600 多所小学的消息引发了广泛抗议，原因是，家长们被告知，它会教导孩子们性别（gender）仅仅是社会习俗的建构。\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"gygKqKJv\"\u003ESchool officials defended the program by arguing that its goal was simply \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Flink.zhihu.com\u002F?target=http%3A\u002F\u002Fwww.lepoint.fr\u002Fsociete\u002Fabcd-de-l-egalite-qu-est-ce-que-c-est-exactement-30-01-2014-1786170_23.php\" class=\" wrap external\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"\u003Eto correct gender stereotypes\u003C\u002Fa\u003E and teach students to respect one another. Vincent Peillon, France’s minister of education, argued that the program did not teach that there was no difference between genders or that gender was constructed. There are a certain number of parents, he \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Flink.zhihu.com\u002F?target=http%3A\u002F\u002Fwww.leparisien.fr\u002Flaparisienne\u002Fsociete\u002Fvincent-peillon-dement-l-enseignement-de-la-theorie-du-genre-a-l-ecole-28-01-2014-3536417.php\" class=\" wrap external\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"\u003Eremarked at the time\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, “who have allowed themselves to be fooled by a completely false rumor that … at school we are teaching little boys to become little girls. That is absolutely false, and it needs to stop” (all translations mine). The previous year, the minister \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Flink.zhihu.com\u002F?target=http%3A\u002F\u002Fwww.liberation.fr\u002Fsociete\u002F2013\u002F06\u002F10\u002Fla-theorie-du-genre-reponse-au-ministre-vincent-peillon_909686\" class=\" wrap external\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"\u003Estated\u003C\u002Fa\u003E that the idea “that there are no physiological, biological differences” between men and women was “absurd.”\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"6fnaTME9\"\u003E学校官员为这个项目辩护，称其目的仅为纠正性别（gender）刻板印象，并教导学生相互尊重。时任法国教育部长 Vincent Peillon 辩称，该项目并未教导「没有性别差异」或「性别是建构出来的」。他接着说，有一些父母「被一个彻底错误的谣言所愚弄」，觉得「我们在学校里教小男孩变成小女孩」——「根本没有这种事情，刹住谣言」。一年前，该部长也公开声明：「男性和女性之间没有生理学及生物学上的差异」的想法，是「荒谬的」。\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"nmVIphlu\"\u003EBut the \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Flink.zhihu.com\u002F?target=http%3A\u002F\u002Fwww.la-croix.com\u002FActualite\u002FFrance\u002FCe-que-dit-l-ABCD-de-l-egalite-2014-02-05-1101997\" class=\" wrap external\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"\u003Elanguage of the original program\u003C\u002Fa\u003E (which has now been replaced bya more “generalized” one) was not as clear as Peillon suggested on the issue of gender. “Gender is a sociological concept,” it states, “that is based on the fact that relations between men and women are socially and culturally constructed. The theory of gender holds that there is a socially constructed sex based on differentiated social roles and stereotypes in addition to anatomical, biological sex, which is innate.” Elsewhere: “Biological differences should not be denied, of course, but those differences should not be a fate.” If sex is innate, how can it also be “socially constructed”? If biological differences are real, what does it mean to say that those differences should not be “a fate”?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"gjHcgbX3\"\u003E然而，原项目（现已被更「笼统」的项目所取代）的语言，在性别议题上，并不像 Vincent Peillon 所暗示的那样清白。「性别（gender）是一个社会学概念，」原项目指出，「这是基于这样一个事实，即男性和女性之间的关系是社会和文化建构起来的。性别（gender）理论认为，除了解剖的、先天的生物学性别之外，还存在一个基于差异化的社会角色以及刻板印象，所建构出来的社会性别（a socially constructed sex）」。原项目中还提到：「当然了，不应否认生物学差异，但这些差异也不该注定一个人的宿命。」然而，如果性别（sex）是先天的，它又如何能是「社会建构」的呢？如果生物学差异是真实的，说这些差异不该「注定一个人的宿命」，又意味着什么呢？\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"uU9131-y\"\u003EIn an article in \u003Ci\u003EThe Boston Globe\u003C\u002Fi\u003E, the French protests were dismissed as \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Flink.zhihu.com\u002F?target=http%3A\u002F\u002Fwww.bostonglobe.com\u002Fideas\u002F2014\u002F03\u002F02\u002Fhow-you-upset-french-gender-theory\u002F1DzXUKcQxB01Hv6pN96gvJ\u002Fstory.html\" class=\" wrap external\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"\u003Emisinformed and motivated by fear\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. Judith Butler even suggested that the real cause of the protests was France’s financial instability. Yet, over the past few years, the French have produced a number of well-informed and damning critiques of gender theory. One of the theory’s strongest critics is Alain de Benoist, a philosopher and champion of paganism with a soft spot for the syndicalist socialism of Edouard Berth. In \u003Ci\u003ENon à la théorie du genre!\u003C\u002Fi\u003E (\u003Ci\u003ENo to Gender Theory\u003C\u002Fi\u003E) (2014), an extract of his much longer \u003Ci\u003ELes démons du bien\u003C\u002Fi\u003E (\u003Ci\u003EThe Demons of the Good\u003C\u002Fi\u003E) (2013), Benoist details the philosophical absurdities and scientific errors of gender theory.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"3RcmHP0q\"\u003E《波士顿环球报》一文中，上述法国家长的抗议被断定只是场由误导信息和恐慌所煽起的闹剧。Judith Butler（朱迪斯·巴特勒）甚至暗示，抗议的真正原因是法国的财政不稳定。可是，在过去几年中，法国产出了许多对性别（gender）理论博闻强识、令人信服的批评。最有力的性别理论批评家之一是 Alain de Benoist——他是哲学家，同时是异教论的拥护者，还有点钟情 Edouard Berth 的工团社会主义（syndicalist socialism）。在他 2014 年的选文 \u003Ci\u003ENon à la théorie du genre!\u003C\u002Fi\u003E（对性别理论说不！），也在他 2013 年 \u003Ci\u003ELes démons du bien\u003C\u002Fi\u003E（《善的魔鬼》）一书中，Alain de Benoist 详细论述了性别理论（gender theory）在哲学上的荒谬和科学上的错误之处。\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"CBFnF_4g\"\u003EFirst, he argues, gender theory rests almost entirely on a terminological confusion. Traditionally, a person’s sex was understood to refer to an aspect of human biology—the end result of the development of a person’s genes. The \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Flink.zhihu.com\u002F?target=http%3A\u002F\u002Fwww.nature.com\u002Fnature\u002Fjournal\u002Fv453\u002Fn7197\u002Ffull\u002Fnature06944.html\" class=\" wrap external\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"\u003Epresence of the SRY gene\u003C\u002Fa\u003E leads to the development of a male (a person with a penis and other biological attributes of the masculine sex). The absence of SRY leads to the development of a female (a person with an ovary and other biological attributes of the female sex). Gender, in turn, was understood to refer to shared characteristics of each sex. Many of these characteristics (body shape, voice, ways of thinking and acting) are shaped in part by a person’s biological sex, but others are almost entirely shaped by culture. Characteristics determined by culture are neither universal nor immutable and can be used to both oppress and honor individuals or groups.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"gop6cyU2\"\u003E首先 Alain de Benoist 认为，性别（gender）理论几乎完全建立在术语的混淆之上。传统上，一个人的性别（sex）被理解为指人类生物学的一个方面——一个人基因发展的最终结果。SRY 基因（\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cb\u003Es\u003C\u002Fb\u003Eex-determining \u003Cb\u003Er\u003C\u002Fb\u003Eegion of \u003Cb\u003EY\u003C\u002Fb\u003E-chromosome\u003C\u002Fi\u003E）的存在导致男性的发育（一个有阴茎和其他男性生物学属性的人）；反之，SRY 基因的缺失导致女性的发育（一个有卵巢和其他女性生物学属性的人）。gender，相应地，则被理解为指男女每种性别（sex）的共享特征。其中许多特征（身体体形、嗓音、思维与行为的方式）由一个人的生物性别（biological sex）部分地来塑造，而其他特征几乎全由文化塑造。由文化决定的特征既不是普遍的，也不是永恒不变的；这些特征既可以用来压迫个人或群体，也可以用来给予他们荣誉或尊敬。\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"lnmeoOAH\"\u003EAccording, however, to Judith Butler in \u003Ci\u003EGender Trouble\u003C\u002Fi\u003E (1990), and most other gender theorists, there is no connection at all between sex and gender (where gender is understood to refer to one’s identity as male or female). Sex “is an analytic attribute of the human; there is no human who is not sexed; sex qualifies the human as a necessary attribute. But sex does not cause gender, and gender cannot be understood to reflect or express sex.” Gender is “always acquired.” In short, a person’s identity as male, female, neither, or both has nothing to do with one’s biological sex (i.e., sex, but I will use this technically redundant phrase for clarity). In “\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Flink.zhihu.com\u002F?target=http%3A\u002F\u002Fwww.sciencedirect.com\u002Fscience\u002Farticle\u002Fpii\u002F027753959390076L\" class=\" wrap external\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"\u003ERethinking Sex and Gender\u003C\u002Fa\u003E” (1993), Christine Delphy goes a step further. While the idea that “sex precedes gender” is “historically explicable,” she writes, by which I take her to mean that it is a fact, it is an idea that is “theoretically unjustifiable,” and one that is “holding back” gender theorists’ “thinking on gender.”\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"jSlo5YG0\"\u003E然而，根据 Judith Butler 1990 年 \u003Ci\u003EGender Trouble\u003C\u002Fi\u003E（《性别麻烦》）一书的观点，以及大多数性别（gender）理论家的说法，sex 和 gender 之间完全没有联系（这里的 gender 被理解指，认同自己为男性或女性的性别认同）。Sex「作为一种人的分析属性；没有不被性别化（sexed）的人；sex 是人之所以为人的必要属性。但 sex 没有导致 gender，gender 也不能被理解为对 sex 的反映或表达」。Gender「始终是后天获得的」。简言之，一个人作为男性、女性、两者都不是或两者都是的性别认同，与他们的生物性别（biological sex，即 sex，但为清楚起见，我会使用这个技术上冗余的短语）无关。在 1993 年「重新思考 Sex 和 Gender」一文中，Christine Delphy 更进一步。她写出：尽管「sex 先于 gender」的想法是「历史上可解释的」。我理解她的意思是这是一个事实。她接着写，这一想法「在理论上无法证明」，还「阻碍」了性别（gender）理论家「基于 gender 的思考」。\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"cJLxwOSa\"\u003EWhile it is absurd to suggest, as Delphy does, that our gender precedes sex, such a remark is based on the idea that scientific categories are arbitrary. Benoist does not discuss this aspect of gender theory, but it is one that is extrapolated from a partial truth poorly expressed in Jacques Derrida’s “Sign, Structure, and Play in the Discourse of the Human Sciences” (1966), and one worth highlighting. Briefly, Derrida argues that both philosophy and science begin with an assumption or a question that becomes the center for the entire enterprise or structure. “The function of this center,” Derrida writes, is not only to “orient, balance, and organize the structure—one cannot in fact conceive of unorganized structure—but above all \u003Ci\u003Eto make sure that the organizing principle of the structure would limit what we might call the play of the structure\u003C\u002Fi\u003E” (emphasis mine). That “play” for Derrida are those ideas or phenomena that don’t quite fit the structure’s “organizing principle.” His point is that philosophy and scientific discourse do not provide exhaustive representations of reality (hardly a news flash, even in 1996). They are merely \u003Ci\u003Eways\u003C\u002Fi\u003E of describing reality—ways that are never complete and always open to revision.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"V7m2i2j7\"\u003E尽管 Christine Delphy 的提议荒谬，即其实我们的 gender 先于 sex，但这样的说法是基于这样一个想法：科学分类是任意主断的（arbitrary）。Alain de Benoist 并未论述性别（gender）理论的这一方面，但它是从雅克·德里达（Jacques Derrida）1966 年「人文科学话语中的结构、符号与嬉戏」（Sign, Structure, and Play in the Discourse of the Human Sciences）中一个表达不清的部分真理推断出来的，这点值得强调。简言之，德里达认为哲学和科学都是以一个假设或问题开始的，这个假设或问题成为整个项目或结构的中心。德里达写道，「这个中心的功能」不仅是「定向、平衡和组织结构——事实上，人们无法想象一个无组织的结构——但最重要的是\u003Ci\u003E确保结构的组织原则能限制\u003Cb\u003E我们\u003C\u002Fb\u003E所说的结构的嬉戏\u003C\u002Fi\u003E」（强调我们的）。对德里达来讲，「嬉戏」是指那些不太符合结构的「组织原则」的想法或现象。他的观点是，哲学和科学话语并没有提供对现实的详尽描述（即使在 1996 年，这也是广为人知的观点）。它们仅仅是描述现实的\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cb\u003E方式\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E——而这些方式从不完整，且总是开放于修订。\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"jCgq7X3k\"\u003EBut just because there is more than one way to describe reality does not mean that \u003Ci\u003Eall descriptions of reality are equally true\u003C\u002Fi\u003E, a point that Derrida himself \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Flink.zhihu.com\u002F?target=http%3A\u002F\u002Fpmc.iath.virginia.edu\u002Ftext-only\u002Fissue.197\u002Fplotnitsky.197\" class=\" wrap external\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"\u003Emay have even acknowledged\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. So the question is, how much sense does it make to hold that gender “precedes” sex or that sex itself is constructed?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"QpR_2Btu\"\u003E但仅仅因为有不止一种方式来描述现实，\u003Cb\u003E并不意味着\u003Ci\u003E所有描述现实的方式同样皆真\u003C\u002Fi\u003E\u003C\u002Fb\u003E，这一点德里达本人甚至可能都承认。所以问题是，坚持 gender「先于」sex，抑或 sex 本身就是建构出来的，这种观点讲得通吗?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"-06xl01d\"\u003ENone at all. To believe that sex is constructed is to hold that it is, as Benoist notes, an illusion. Gender theorists espouse this fantastical position because they have taken the uncontroversial observation that \u003Ci\u003Esome\u003C\u002Fi\u003E characteristics associated with gender are socially constructed and applied it to biological differences as well. What empirical evidence do they offer that our sex, our identities as male and female, are constructed and not the result of nature? None. That’s because, Benoist writes, quoting Michel Schneider, a member of the Académie française and past Minister of Culture, “We don’t choose our sex, and there are only two.”\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"aE7ihgkQ\"\u003E根本讲不通。认为 sex 是被建构的，就是认为它是——正如 Benoist 所指出的——一种幻觉。性别（gender）理论家们持有这种异想天开的立场，是因为她们将与 gender 相关的\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cb\u003E一些\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E特征是由社会建构的，这一毫无争议的观察，也应用到了生物学差异上。她们提供了什么实证证据来证明，我们的 sex、我们作为男性或女性的身份，是建构的，而非大自然的结果？没有。这是因为，Benoist 写道，边引用法兰西学术院、前文化部长 Michel Schneider 的话：「我们不选择自己的性别（sex），而且只有两种」。\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"EXSFmI-J\"\u003EBenoist acknowledges that while there are only two sexes, there are a “plurality of practices … or sexual preferences.” It is nonsense to say that biological sex does not determine one’s identity as a man or a woman because that’s \u003Ci\u003Eexactly\u003C\u002Fi\u003E what biological sex determines. What it doesn’t determine, Benoist writes, is one’s sexual practices. “The multiplicity of sexual preferences does not make the biological sexes disappear, nor does it increase the number. Sexual orientation, whatever it might be, does not negate the sexed body.”\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"hbViwTpr\"\u003EBenoist 承认，虽然只有两种性别（sex），但存在「多元的实践…… 和性取向」。声称生物性别不决定一个人作为男人或女人的身份是无稽之谈，因为这\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cb\u003E正是\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E生物性别所决定的。它所决定不了的是，Benoist 写道，一个人的性实践。「性取向的多样性并没有使生物性别消失，也没有增加其数量。性取向，无论是什么，也不能否定性别化（sexed）的身体。」\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"l5cWUPIT\"\u003EThis gets us to Benoist’s second objection to gender theory. Our biological sex not only causes the human body to develop genitals, but it affects how we think and act in profound ways, without, of course, entirely determining either thought or action. But in refusing to acknowledge that sex has anything to do with gender, gender theorists are forced to deny or ignore increasingly convincing scientific evidence to the contrary. “From the first days of life,” Benoist writes,\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"zOkxuFOo\"\u003E这就引出了 Benoist 对性别（gender）理论的第二条反对意见。我们的生物性别不仅导致人体的生殖器官发育，而且还会在——当然，不完全地决定思维和行为方式的情况下，深刻地影响我们的思维和行为方式。但是，由于性别（gender）理论家拒绝承认 sex 与 gender 有任何关系，他们被迫否认和忽视越来越令人信服的相反的科学证据。「从出生的头几天起，」Benoist 写道：\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cblockquote data-pid=\"JgjKhigr\"\u003Eboys look primarily at mechanized objects or objects in movement while girls most often search for visual contact with human faces. Only a few hours after birth, a girl responds to the cries of other infants while a boy shows no interest. The tendency to show empathy is stronger in girls than in boys long before any external influence (or “social expectations”) have been able to assert themselves. At all ages and stages of development, girls are more sensitive to their emotional states and to those of others than boys … From a young age, boys resort to physical strategies where girls turn to verbal ones … From the age of two, boys are more aggressive and take more risks than girls.\u003Cbr\u002F\u003E男孩主要关注机械物体和运动中的物体，而女孩则更多寻找与人脸的视觉接触。出生后仅几小时，女孩会对其他婴儿的哭声做出反应，而男孩则表现出无兴趣。在任何外部影响（或「社会期望」）施加前，女孩展现同理心的倾向比男孩更强。在所有年龄和发育阶段，女孩对自己和他人的情绪状态比男孩更敏感…… 从小，男孩倾向诉诸肢体策略，而女孩则会诉诸口头策略…… 从两岁开始，男孩比女孩更具攻击性，也更愿意承担风险。\u003C\u002Fblockquote\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"ijt4arUA\"\u003E(These are \u003Ci\u003Egeneral\u003C\u002Fi\u003E differences to which there are, of course, exceptions. Nor do such initial tendencies (in young girls, for example, to express empathy, or in boys to take risks) mean that those tendencies are unchangeable. Boys should express empathy, and girls take risks. As noted below, one of the reasons that egalitarianism and gender theory have become so popular is that they take seriously the danger of treating such \u003Ci\u003Einitial\u003C\u002Fi\u003E biological dispositions as immutable. However, just because certain initial tendencies are not immutable does not mean that there are no differences between the sexes or that sex is an illusion. Treating it as such, as gender theory does, destroys difference altogether, usually redefining femininity in masculine terms, and ironicially accomplishing the very thing they supposedly set out to combat.)\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"QQ1znZ7L\"\u003E（这些是\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cb\u003E一般\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E差异，当然也有例外。也不意味着这些初始倾向(例如，女孩表现同理心，或男孩更愿意冒险)不可改变。男孩应当表现同理心，女孩也应当冒冒险。如下所述，平等主义(egalitarianism，实为“平均主义”)和性别(gender)理论之所以变得如此流行的一部分原因，就在于她们(那些性别理论家们)严肃对待这样\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cb\u003E初始的\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E生物上的性格倾向，并将其视作不可改变的危险之物。然而，仅仅因为某些初始的倾向并非不可改变，也不意味着男女性别(sexes)间没有差异，或者性别(sex)是一种幻觉。将其视为幻觉，正如性别(gender)理论所作的，就是完全摧毁了差异，通常还是用阳刚的(masculine，男子气概的)术语来重定义女子气质(femininity)，具有讽刺意味地实现了她们所声称要反对的事情。）\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"-WJ9kAGk\"\u003EOur brains are sexed. Benoist writes that “the hormonal impregnation of the fetus has a direct affect on the organization of neural circuits, creating a masculine brain and a feminine brain, which can be distinguished by a variety of anatomical, physiological and biochemical markers.”\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"qvarRat_\"\u003E我们的大脑是性别化（sexed）的。Benoist 写道，「激素在胎儿期的渗透会直接影响神经回路的组织，从而形成男性化和女性化的大脑，两者可通过各种解剖学、生理学和生化学标记加以区分。」\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"YXBS4qve\"\u003EEven our cells are sexed. \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Flink.zhihu.com\u002F?target=http%3A\u002F\u002Fwww.nytimes.com\u002F2014\u002F04\u002F24\u002Fscience\u002Fresearchers-see-new-importance-for-y-chromosome.html\" class=\" wrap external\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"\u003EAccording to David C. Page\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, director of The Whitehead Institute at MIT, “Throughout human bodies, the cells of males and females are biochemically different,” which affects, among other things, how men and women contract and fight diseases.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"0Kgv-CGT\"\u003E甚至连我们的细胞也是性别化（sexed）的。麻省理工学院 Whitehead Institute 的前所长，David C. Page 说，「在整个人体内，男性和女性的细胞在生化上存在差异，」这会影响许多事情，包括男性和女性对疾病的感染和抵抗方式。\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"QWsoABsD\"\u003EA common response to the above is to suggest that such remarks are “sexist.” But this view is based on an egalitarian feminism that, as Benoist puts it, defines “equality” as “sameness” and is, in turn, distinctly anti-feminine:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"q2kgaYhN\"\u003E对上述言论的一种常见反应是指出此类论调是「性别歧视」。但这种反击是基于一种平等主义的女权主义（egalitarian feminism）的，正如 Benoist 所指，这种主义将「平等」定义为「相同」，而这反过来，又明显地反女性：\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cblockquote data-pid=\"dhsPeTsX\"\u003EUnderstanding equality as sameness alone, [gender theory] follows the modern ideal: society is supposed to consist of self-sufficient subjects, without any engagement or mutual attachment other than those made by the will, reason, or contract. Its credo is that women must ‘understand their identity as determined by liberty and not as the result of belonging [to a particular group]’ (Danièle Sallenave)—which is to say, that they should avoid thinking of themselves as women at all costs.\u003Cbr\u002F\u003E单纯将平等理解为相同，[性别(gender)理论] 遵循着如下的现代理想：社会应当只由自给自足（self-sufficient）的个体组成，除了意志、理性或契约建立的联系之外，不应有其他任何参与或相互依附。其信条是，女性必须「理解她们的身份是由自由（liberty）决定的，而非属于 [一个特定群体] 的结果」(Danièle Sallenave)——也就是说，她们应该不惜一切代价避免将自己视为女性。\u003C\u002Fblockquote\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"AxU9XRoI\"\u003EThe idea that equality requires sameness developed from Derrida’s idea that binary categorization (presence\u002Fabsence, masculine\u002Ffeminine) always leads to a hierarchy in which one term dominates the other. In order to combat this supposedly “violent” hierarchy, feminists like Butler and others battled difference itself. In 2001, Monique Wittig wrote that we need to “destroy—politically, philosophically, symbolically—the categories ‘man’ and ‘woman’.” The irony, however, is that it is rarely masculinity that is destroyed in egalitarian feminism. What most often happens is that femininity is redefined in masculine terms. To be a \u003Ci\u003Ereal\u003C\u002Fi\u003E woman in the egalitarian view is to act like a man. In this sense, popular discourse to the contrary, egalitarian feminism has almost no interest in “diversity” because it is founded on the idea that difference—even biological difference—must be destroyed.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"wpiA6iAC\"\u003E「平等需要相同」这种想法来源于德里达的观点，即二元分类（在场\u002F缺席，阳性的(男子气概的)\u002F阴性的(女子气质的)）总是会导致一种等级制，其中一端的术语的权力主导着另一端。为了对抗这种「暴力的」等级制，像 Judith Butler 等的女权主义者与差异本身作斗争。2001 年，Monique Wittig（莫尼克·维蒂格）写道，我们需要「在政治上、哲学上和符号象征上——摧毁——『男人』和『女人』这两个类别」。然而，讽刺的是，在平等主义的女权主义中被摧毁的很少是男子气概（masculinity）。最常发生的情况是，女子气质（femininity）被以阳刚的（masculine，男子气概的）术语来重定义。在平等主义看来，要想成为一个\u003Ci\u003E\u003Cb\u003E真正的\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E女人，就意味着得像男人那样行事。从这个意义上讲，与流行话语相反，平等主义的女权主义几乎对「多样性」不感兴趣，因为它建立在这样一个观念上——即使是生物学差异——也必须被摧毁。\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"ozqYD4Qy\"\u003EBenoist’s explanation of where this sort of radical egalitarianism came from and how it became so popular is intriguing but somewhat less convincing. (In \u003Ci\u003ELes démons du bien\u003C\u002Fi\u003E he argues, if I understand him correctly, that it is the result of Christianity [perhaps wrongly understood, though he is somewhat unclear on this], capitalism and a bastardized Marxism.) His criticism of gender theory, however—its equivocations, errors, and absurdities—is one of the best and most extensive to date.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp data-pid=\"qK1m0u8t\"\u003EBenoist 对这种激进平等主义从何而来，以及为何变得如此流行的解释非常有趣，但稍微没我们所讲的正题那般令人信服。（在 \u003Ci\u003ELes démons du bien (\u003C\u002Fi\u003E《善的魔鬼》) 一书中，他认为，如果我理解正确的话，这是基督教 [也许是我的误解，尽管他在此也描述得不太清楚]、资本主义和被歪曲的马克思主义的结果。）然而，他对性别（gender）理论的批评——其模棱、错误及荒谬之处——是迄今为止最好、最全面的。\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cblockquote data-pid=\"M6Lrkxf9\"\u003EMicah Mattix (Ph.D., topComments.content: 通过主张“自己的灵魂属于另一个性别”，改变性征（甚至仅是改变习惯）后自己就成为了另一个性别——实际上是在用当今社会的性别刻板印象去对抗刻板印象，用偏见去对抗偏见。如果感觉自己是另一个性别就是另一个性别，那本质上就是在说，性别实际上是幻觉。那么如果真是幻觉，这个分类也就不必要存在了——然而性别本质上是先天决定的，改变不了的，这个分类有着生物学、生理学的本质基础，所以应该存在。从社会角度而言，所谓“跨性别”，也只是在刻板印象中跳槽，跳到另一个所谓“社会性别”（gender）的刻板印象的槽中。然而所谓社会性别和gender theory，本身就是建立在刻板印象上的，反而这才是一种幻觉。真正应该做的是承认客观生物学、生理学基础上的性别及随之而来的性别差异，不鼓励男女发展出任何对应的刻板印象（“男的要阳刚，女的要阴柔”），然而，男女两性各自表现出来的所有性征和性格特点，不管在当今社会多么不符合潮流，都应视为男女本质的外延。故当今社会的跨性别并没有真正的跨“性别”，只是在跨stereotype罢了。就像未来机器人热情、友好得再像人，人却冷漠得像冰冷的机器人，机器人也不可能成为人，也不应该在此刻板印象上认同机器人是人，人反而是机器人。
